explanation: To analyze violations of the MISRA C rule on function parameter modification in run_usock, the following are needed: callee functions (make_blocking, send_all, MHD_upgrade_action, ws_receive_frame, ws_send_frame), since calls within run_usock may indirectly modify parameters; pthread_mutex_lock/unlock and abort, as their behavior affects control flow and resource states; standard functions malloc, free, snprintf to assess memory and string handling related to pointer parameters; global variables CLIENT_SOCKS, MUTEX, and constants MHD_INVALID_SOCKET, MHD_UPGRADE_ACTION_CLOSE because they are accessed or modified possibly through pointer parameters; and the struct definitions WsData and MHD_UpgradeResponseHandle to understand the pointer members and data they hold, clarifying if pointers passed as parameters are modified themselves or only the objects they point to. This comprehensive set supports determining whether pointer parameters are reassigned (violating the rule) or safely used.
